intro: Psychotria urbaniana, commonly known as the "Urbaniana Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It typically grows in shaded, humid environments such as forests and understoreys. Psychotria urbaniana is also known for its psychoactive properties due to the presence of alkaloids like dimethyltryptamine (DMT).
